Episode Summary: Episode # 10643 ~ Baby, Baby, Who's Got the Baby?
Recap: A couple of Kim's pole dancer friends show up at the Buchanan mansion for Kim's wedding. Kevin warns Kim not to hurt Clint. Clint tells Bo & Nora about the wedding. Todd taunts Kevin about Kelly turning down his marriage proposal. Dani sees the two of them fighting. Todd tells her that he won't tell Tea or the school that Dani is skipping school if she spends the day with him. She decides to go back to school. Blair suspects that Todd and Kelly are becoming involved.

Charlie tells Dorian that Viki has asked for a divorce. Dorian encourages him to ask Viki for a second chance, but he says he is out of chances with Viki. Viki confides to Tea that Charlie shut her out when they needed each other most, and she doesn't think their marriage will recover. Dorian goes to see Viki in Charlie's defense.

Rex admits that he has missed Gigi and wants to be with her. Greg informs Schuyler that the ethics charges against him were dropped. When Rachel is happy about that, Greg tells says he can't understand why she is defending an addict. She reminds him that she is a recovering addict, too. Sierra Rose is released from the hospital. Schuyler goes to pick her up but before he can take her home, Elijah comes in with a court order granting temporary custody to Gigi. Tea arrives at the hospital just in time to stop Gigi from taking Sierra Rose.
Transcript: Nigel: May I help you?
Leah: We're here for the wedding.
Nigel: Pardon?
Laudine: Hello? The wedding? Ice sculptures and a cake and a DJ?
Nigel: I'm sorry. What wedding?
Kim: Mine.
[Leah and Laudine laugh]
[SCENE_BREAK]
Clint: So, we're good to go. Kim signed the prenuptial. No. She didn't even ask for any changes. Yeah, the paperwork's on its way to you. Okay. Thank you. Yeah, I'll see you after the wedding. Bye.
Kevin: Sorry I'm late, Dad.
Clint: Melinda's funeral?
Kevin: Yeah, I just wanted to make sure Kelly was all right before I left.
Clint: You could've skipped me for Kelly.
Kevin: Yeah, I don't think that would've been the best idea.
Clint: Comforting your ex-wife?
Kevin: I figured getting out while the getting was good was a better idea.
Clint: What happened?
Kevin: Well, I asked Kelly to marry me, and she turned me down flat.
[SCENE_BREAK]
Dorian: I think Melinda would've loved the carnations.
Kelly: They were always her favorite.
Blair: It was a very lovely service, I thought.
Dorian: I'm glad you decided to keep it just family.
Kelly: Yeah, my mother likes-- has always liked things simple.
Dorian: Wish Kevin felt that way. I thought he'd come by La Boulaie, but he went speeding off without saying a word.
[Doorbell rings]
Dorian: Oh! Maybe that's him now.
Kelly: Please no.
Blair: Okay, Kelly. Um... do you want to tell me what's going on with you and Kevin?
[SCENE_BREAK]
Viki: Thank you so much for coming.
Téa: Of course. Just sorry to hear you need legal help. What's going on?
Viki: I've asked Charlie for a divorce. I was hoping you could handle it for me, please.
[SCENE_BREAK]
Dorian: Charlie, haven't you gotten into enough trouble hanging out with me?
[SCENE_BREAK]
Nurse: The baby's vitals were perfect all night.
Gigi: Oh, thank God.
Rex: So, what does this mean?
Nurse: Your niece can go home later today.
Gigi: Oh, do you hear that, little girl? You're coming home.
Nurse: Her father is thrilled, too.
[SCENE_BREAK]
Rachel: You know, I was thinking we should get a cabinet for all the diapers and baby wipes, extra formula.
Schuyler: Yeah, it's not exactly the media center we talked about, is it?
Rachel: The baby doesn't need digital sound.
Schuyler: I know, I know. I'm just saying you didn't exactly sign on for a baby when you agreed to be my roommate.
Rachel: I can't wait. If this happens, I will be so happy.
Schuyler: Hey. "If"?
Rachel: Gigi might get custody. Schuyler, you need to be prepared for that.
Schuyler: No. No. Not today. Not today. I mean, that's the mantra, isn't it? One day at a time? Well, when Sierra gets released today, she's coming home with me.
[SCENE_BREAK]
Gigi: She looks so much better. Her face even looks like it filled out a little bit.
Rex: Don't worry. When we get her home, we'll pack some weight on her.
Gigi: Oh, it'll be so good to see her out of that incubator.
Rex: Shane cannot wait to show her that new night light. What?
Gigi: What if Schuyler takes her home today?
Gigi: I'd feel better if we had gotten into that ethics hearing yesterday.
Rex: How can they say that non-hospital staff can't come in? We had real evidence.
Gigi: Only what Schuyler told us.
Rex: Against his own best interest. He'd be toast right now.
Gigi: If he's cleared, it's gonna make it a lot harder to make my case for custody.
[SCENE_BREAK]
Schuyler: It was weird, sitting in that hearing like-- like a potted plant while Téa just lied for me.
Rachel: Did she outright lie?
Schuyler: Well, she didn't let me tell the truth, that I didn't actually give the oxytocin to Stacy.
Rachel: Well, you couldn't say that without admitting that you took the drug in the first place. If Rex and Gigi had testified, you would've went there.
Schuyler: Yeah. Instead I just-- I squeaked by on evasive maneuvers.
Rachel: Schuy, do you know that you screwed up?
Schuyler: Yeah--royally.
Rachel: Are you trying to make it right?
Schuyler: Best I can.
Rachel: Do you want custody of your daughter?
Schuyler: Yes, that's why I sat there and I took it. I mean, I want to raise my daughter and I can't do that from jail, so--
Rachel: It might not have to come to that.

Schuyler: Okay, if the ethics panel knew that I stole the drugs, they would automatically assume that I gave it to Stacy. They can charge me for that, and the only person who knows that I didn't...is Kim, and who knows if she'd clear me?
[SCENE_BREAK]
Kim: Look at you!
Laudine: Uh-uh. You're the one, girl, working that outfit.
Leah: I missed you! And now you're getting married. Oh, my God.
Kim: I'm so glad you guys came.
Laudine: Yeah. Usually I say no to the private jet ride.
Leah: Are you really getting married?
Kim: Mm-hmm. Today.
Nigel: Aah!
Kim: You okay, Nige?
Nigel: Uh...
Kim: Guys, meet my butler. This is Nigel.
Nigel: I am the Buchanan butler.
Kim: Okay, we need some Bloody Marys and some brunch. Oh, and something vegan for Laudine.
Laudine: Over it.
Kim: Oh, okay. Sides of bacon for everybody.
Nigel: Will I have time before I'm called to make ice sculptures?
Kim: Hmm?
Nigel: I understand from this young woman...
Leah: Leah.
Nigel: Yes, I'm sure. She tells me there's to be a wedding.
Kim: Uh-huh. That's right.
Nigel: And when will the happy nuptials be?
Kim: Today. Clint didn't tell you?
Nigel: No.
Kim: Brunch.
Laudine: Uh-oh.
Kim: Oh, no, no, don't worry. It's happening.
Leah: But--you're sure? Because if he liked it, then he should've put a ring on it.
Laudine: Mm-hmm.
[SCENE_BREAK]
Todd: Let me get this straight. So you asked Kelly to marry you right after her mother died. That's funny. Kind of surprised she turned you down.
Clint: Todd, would you just stay the hell out of this?
Todd: Such a sad, little buddy, aren't you? The woman cheated on you with your son and you still want her. You just can't man up, can you? God, how big a loser do you have to be if you want a-- aah!
Clint: Todd, stop it.
[SCENE_BREAK]
Kelly: It was sweet that Kevin proposed, but...I couldn't. Too much has happened.
[Blair scoffs]
Kelly: What?
Blair: Well, I'm just surprised, you know. You slept with his son Duke. You gave birth to his grandson. And you guys still stay together? What's bigger than that?
Kelly: Maybe the fact that you slept with Kevin.
Blair: Oh, you know what? No, no, no, no. You can't blame me for your problems with Kevin. You don't want to marry the guy, that's fine, but do not put that off on me.
[SCENE_BREAK]
Charlie: I just dropped by to offer my condolences. I heard about your sister.
Dorian: Thank you.
Charlie: So, what happened?
Dorian: Apparently, she had a heart attack. Only trouble is, she had absolutely no history of heart trouble.
Charlie: So, you think... think that Mitch did it.
Dorian: He could have. He's still threatening my girls.
[Charlie sighs]
Charlie: Okay, so, what are you gonna do?
Dorian: I'm not gonna let him control me anymore. This has to end.
[SCENE_BREAK]
Téa: I had no idea you and Charlie were having trouble.
Viki: It's the end result of a lot of things that have happened.
Téa: It's not about the shooting, right? Because you know that Charlie was aiming at Mitch.
Viki: Oh, I know that, and no, it's not just that.
Téa: What?

Viki: After Jared died, Charlie shut me out of his life. Completely. He did not trust me to help him. He went out, he got a gun, he was going to murder someone. He put everything ahead of our marriage.
[SCENE_BREAK]
Rex: Eli's on his way. He filed for temporary custody so we can take Sierra home.
Gigi: What did they say?

Rex: He's hopeful. Schuyler looks bad for all the right reasons. Tried to duck out of being the father. He's in trouble with the hospital. But he's still the dad, so any order we get today will be temporary. There will still be a full- blown hearing.
Gigi: Look. It's like she's waving. It's so good to see her moving around. Isn't she gorgeous?
Rex: She looks a little like you.
Gigi: You think?
Rex: The mouth especially.
Gigi: You mean big? Ha.
Rex: Yeah. She'll grow into it.
Gigi: Thanks for being here, Rex. It means more to me than you'll ever know.
Rex: It's where I wanna be. With you. I missed you.
[SCENE_BREAK]
Kelly: Zane was the reason we made it this long. Kevin and I are just done. Now with him away at school, it's just the two of us...we can't hide behind anything. It's time we both moved on.
Blair: So, what's next?
Kelly: Maybe lunch?
Blair: No, Kelly, I meant--
Kelly: I know what you meant. I just--I can't think further than that, okay? Having to go through my mother's things...
Blair: I know. I'm sorry. Sorry, sorry. I know this is tough. If it were my mother, I-- you know, I probably couldn't think, either. Wait a minute. Is that Todd's?
Kelly: Yeah.
[SCENE_BREAK]
Kevin: That ought shut you up.
Todd: Hey there.
Dani: Isn't that your nephew Kevin?
Todd: Yes. Yeah. How'd you know that?
Dani: Starr showed me a picture. You're beating up your own nephew?
Todd: He started it.
Dani: What are you? 8?
Todd: What are you doing out of school?
Dani: There was a bomb scare. They sent us all home for the day.
Todd: Danielle, you know why that's a dumb lie? Because I can check it.
Dani: Okay, I ditched. What are you gonna do--ground me?
Todd: Your mom would.
Dani: Only she doesn't listen to you, either.
Todd: Either?
Dani: You don't get to tell me what to do, Todd.
[SCENE_BREAK]
Clint: You okay?

Kevin: Yeah. The guy fights like a little girl, anyway. Better with his lip. You know, what he said about Kelly is true, though. So stupid. Ask her to marry me so soon after Melinda died. It's just that we've been in limbo for so long, you know. I just wanted--
[Kevin sighs]
Kevin: I just wanted an answer. Boy, I got it.
Clint: I'm sorry, son.
Kevin: Yeah. Don't be. Just go back to London, get on with my life.
Clint: Could you stay on for a couple more days, at least? Because I'm gonna need a best man.
Kevin: Excuse me?
Clint: I need a best man. I'm gonna get married. Say, why don't you two join us and we'll save me a courtesy call.
Kevin: Dad, who are you marrying?
Clint: Who else? Kimberly Andrews.
[SCENE_BREAK]
Kim: Clint hasn't had time to buy a ring. Things moved so fast.
Leah: But you're sure?
Kim: I wouldn't have sent the jet if I wasn't sure.
Laudine: Listen to you. You "sent the jet."
Kim: Well, Clint did, because I asked him to.
Leah: The pilot said you have horses.
Kim: Mm-hmm. A dozen thoroughbreds.
Leah: And the house?
Kim: Oh, my God, you guys are gonna have your own wing, and your suites have balconies and fireplaces.
Leah: Stop.
Kim: And a great view of the mountains.
Laudine: So...you sold yourself to the highest bidder.
Leah: Laudine!
Kim: No, let her talk.
Laudine: We always knew what you were.
Leah: She's just jealous.
Kim: And what do you think you're doing on the pole, Laudine, huh?
Laudine: I'm an artist. And when I get married, it's gonna be for love.
Kim: Okay. When you're pushing 35 and Stan kicks your dimpled butt to the curb, then you can talk to me about love.
Laudine: It could happen.
Kim: Oh, he'll definitely kick your dimpled butt to the curb.
Laudine: I mean love.
Leah: Jeez, if you guys are already fighting sober, it's gonna be a long day. Where's Stacy?
Kim: What?
Laudine: There's a love story. She gave up everything for Rick.
Kim: Rex.
Leah: Yeah, yeah. Rex. She never shut up about him. Did she ever get him?
Kim: Stacy's dead.
[SCENE_BREAK]
Gigi: Eli. What's the word?
Eli: No word yet. The papers have been filed, and I told the judge the baby may be released today. He seems to understand the urgency.
Rex: So, does that mean we get a quick answer?
Eli: Maybe. But also maybe not. You need to be prepared that the baby may be released to Schuyler today.
Gigi: It's not right.
Eli: Even if he is a lousy dad, the bottom line is he is Sierra's father.
[SCENE_BREAK]
Rachel: I'm gonna organize the baby's stuff.
Schuyler: You know, Rachel, at some point, you get to stop helping me. I mean, you-- you should be furious. I put you in a lousy situation.
Rachel: You confided in a professional counselor.
Schuyler: I leaned on a friend, and you really went out on a limb by hiding that medicine vial.
Rachel: I called a lawyer to protect your interest, and gave it to her.
Schuyler: Okay, still, you're with Greg. You're with Greg, Rachel.
Rachel: And?
Schuyler: And he came down really hard on me at the hearing yesterday. I mean, he wants me thrown out of the hospital.
Rachel: Well, I don't. You made a mistake, Schuyler, and you're not a criminal. You shouldn't lose your career over it.
Schuyler: Okay, well...what if Greg finds out you're helping me?
[Door opens]
Greg and Rachel: Hi.
Schuyler: Hey.
Greg: Schuyler, we tried to find you at the hospital. Wanted to tell you in person.
Schuyler: Is this about the-- the hearing?
Greg: Mm-hmm. The ethics committee made their ruling on your case.
[SCENE_BREAK]
Gigi: Come on, Eli. We've gotta have a chance at getting custody.
Eli: We do. It's just a slim one. I just want you to be prepared. Schuyler is the baby's closest blood relative, and as I told you, the courts favor biological parents.
Rex: But you told the judge...
Eli: I slammed this Schuyler kid, Rex. I threw in all the evidence we had, even the hearsay.
Rex: And the fact that he's under investigation right now for stealing a drug?
Eli: Yeah, that was at the top of the list, but it's just a charge. Now, if the committee finds him guilty, that'll be a big help.
Gigi: How big?
Eli: If Schuyler's guilty, I'm sure you'll get the baby.
[SCENE_BREAK]
Schuyler: What--what was the ruling?
Greg: You had a good lawyer. She talked legal circles around the doctors in the room.
Rachel: And?
Greg: And a majority of the committee decided there wasn't enough evidence to prove that Schuyler stole the oxytocin. They're dropping the charge and the investigation.
Schuyler: Thank you so much. It's done. It's done.
Rachel: Congratulations.
Greg: Don't thank me. I voted against you.
Schuyler: My baby. I have to get my baby right now. Oh, my God.
Rachel: You want me to come with?
Schuyler: No. No. I'm good. You've done more than enough. Car seat's in the car. I'm set.
Rachel: Wait, wait. Good luck. I can't wait to see her.
Schuyler: Thank you so much. Bye!
Greg: Schuyler's bringing a baby back here?
Rachel: He lives here.
Greg: And you're comfortable with that?
Rachel: I love babies.
Greg: Schuyler raising a baby-- do you really think this is a good idea?
Rachel: I think Schuyler will be a wonderful, attentive father.
Greg: Yeah. He'll make it look good.
Rachel: What is that supposed to mean?
Greg: Come on, Rachel. Schuyler stole that oxytocin from the hospital. I know it. So do you.
[SCENE_BREAK]

Viki: And in the end, that mattered so much more than the drinking, or even the fact that he accidentally shot my daughter Jessica. He walked out when-- when I needed him, but much worse than that, he walked out when he needed me. He did not trust me.
Téa: Are you sure?
Viki: Oh, absolutely. He, I guess, thought that I just wasn't able to help him. I wasn't enough.
Téa: You're more than enough, and Charlie knows that.
Viki: He went to Dorian. Dorian. He listened to her. He trusted her. He allowed her to convince him that it was a really good idea to commit murder. I just don't see any way back from that.
[SCENE_BREAK]
Charlie: You're not gonna do anything crazy, are you?
Dorian: He's in prison.
Charlie: Yeah. He's still breathing.
Dorian: Ah.
Charlie: Look, I am trying. I am staying sober. But that man cost me everything. I let him cost me everything.
Dorian: Viki can be... very forgiving. It's one of her finer attributes. Go to her. Ask her for a second chance.
Charlie: No, we--we've run out of second chances. Viki asked me for a divorce.
[SCENE_BREAK]
Blair: So, when did you see Todd?
Kelly: He was at the church making a fat donation.
Blair: Oh, right. He's buying his way into heaven. Hmm.
Kelly: Uhh. More like trying to impress Téa and his daughter.
Blair: Oh, my gosh. He can be such a knucklehead sometimes.
Kelly: That's what I told him. I mean, he's trying so hard and he's just doing it all wrong. You know what? I felt sorry for him.
Blair: Don't.
[SCENE_BREAK]
Todd: You know, I did spend a lot of money to keep you in school after you stole those test answers.
Dani: Nobody asked you to do that.

Todd: I have to say, you seemed better than that, though, Dani. You're obviously very smart. I saw your grades from Warwick, and I understand you really hated it there. You were still kicking ass. It must be tough for you here, though, huh?
Dani: Like you know.
Todd: Well, I would like to know. Why don't you tell me? They still talking smack about me in school?
Dani: That was tough, but I'm tougher.
Todd: See, I knew that.
Dani: The school thing, it's not about you.
Todd: All right. Well, they're idiots.
Dani: You want to know what's wrong?
Todd: Yeah.
Dani: I'm not going to have a father-daughter chat with a rapist.
[SCENE_BREAK]
Kelly: Why can't I feel sorry for Todd?
Blair: Because he isn't worth your pity.
Kelly: Are you jealous?
Blair: No.
Kelly: Well, trust me. I'm no threat to that twisted, little dance you two do.
Blair: Oh, trust me, Todd and I are done.
Kelly: You are?
Blair: Mm-hmm.
Kelly: That means there's someone else. Who's the lucky guy?
[SCENE_BREAK]
[Telephone ringing]
Gigi: Is that the judge?
Eli: It's the courthouse. This could be the ruling. Excuse me. Elijah Clarke.
[SCENE_BREAK]
Kim: She died trying to get to the baby across the lake.
Leah: That is so sad.
Kim: I know. So I'm marrying Clint, and we're adopting the baby. She's still in the hospital, but she got through her surgery okay, so we should have her back at the house soon.
Laudine: You are going to be a mom?
Kim: Stacy wanted me to take care of her kid.
Laudine: You hate kids.
Kim: I fell in love when I saw her.
Laudine: Or is that how you bagged a Buchanan and all his money?
Kim: Were you always this bitchy and I'm just now noticing? I'm not marrying Clint for the money.
Laudine: Then why are you marrying him?
[SCENE_BREAK]
Kevin: Well, I'm happy for you, Dad, and I'd be proud to stand up with you. Listen, I'm going to make a few phone calls and rearrange my flight.
Clint: Oh, God, don't worry about a flight. After the wedding, just take my jet. Once it takes the bridesmaids back to Vegas, then it's all yours.
Kevin: Okay. Uncle Bo, Nora, I'll catch up with you later.
Bo: Okay, Kev.
Clint: See you, Kevin.
Bo: Hmm.
Clint: Aren't you going to congratulate me?
Nora: Okay, are you doing this thing with Kim just to pay us back?
Clint: You know, that was our trouble from the get-go. You always thought that I wasn't that bright.
Bo: Nobody is saying that.
Nora: You did use Kim to get back at me.
Clint: Our relationship has simply blossomed.
Nora: Soul mate?
Clint: One never knows, Nora.
Bo: Well, it is sudden. Have you--have you taken some time to kind of get things together before the wedding?
Clint: I think you're talking about a prenuptial agreement.
Bo: I think that would be a good idea.
Clint: Look, don't you worry, Bo. Your part of Asa's money and B.E.-- it's safe.
Bo: That's not why I'm saying that.
Clint: Oh. Then you were worried about me?
Bo: Yeah.
Clint: Uh-huh. You know, I think while the two of you were cheating on me, you determined that I was easy to dupe.
Nora: Oh, Clint...
Clint: And now you think I need to be protected?
[SCENE_BREAK]
Nigel: Brunch is served. Sides of pork, all around.
Kim: Thanks, Nige.
Leah: The stiff is gone.
Laudine: You were good. He heard that it's "not the money" thing.
Kim: It isn't the money. Not just the money. I really like Clint.
Leah: How's the sex?
Kim: None of your business!
Laudine: That bad?
Leah: It's okay. You'll be the show wife.
[Kim sighs]
Leah: The old guy can take you around and you make it look good. But you higher a tennis instructor who's shredded.
Kim: I can't do that to Clint.
Leah: Why not?
Kim: Because I wouldn't do that to him. Besides, there's a prenup. It says if I cheat on Clint, he could toss me out with nothing.
Leah: Tell me you didn't sign that.
[SCENE_BREAK]
Bo: Clint, nobody thinks you're a fool. I'm worried because I care about you.
Clint: Well, don't worry, because the money and I are going to be just fine.
Bo: You know what you're doing?
Clint: Oh, yeah, because I've learned. This time, I've got a prenup with a fidelity clause in it.
Nora: Oh, dear God.
Clint: What? Don't you think that's a good idea, that the wife should think maybe--oh, I don't know--twice before cheating?
Nora: Okay, do you really want to start this again? Really?
Clint: No.
Bo: Well, what do you want? You don't get to pick a fight with me because, you know, we're not brothers anymore.
Clint: Oh, dear God--is that what I said?
Bo: Those were your exact words. But I've got news for you--we will always be brothers. And if you say you're happy, I'm happy for you.
[SCENE_BREAK]
Todd: Yeah, I was a rotten guy.
[Dani scoffs]
Dani: Was?
Todd: Well, I'm trying to do better. For example.
Dani: You give away money? So what? You're rich. You'll never miss that money. It doesn't change anything.
Todd: Well, it's going to help the church and the school, don't you think?
Dani: Whatever. Stop staring. You still make me sick.
Todd: Okay. That's--it seems like you're stuck with me, though. Unless you want me to take you back to school.
Dani: No.
Todd: Well, here's the deal. You want to blow off school, that's fine with me.
Dani: What's the catch?
Todd: I want you to spend the day with me. You do that and I promise, I won't turn you in to the school or your mom. Just give me a chance.
[SCENE_BREAK]
Viki: So, do you think you will be able to help me?
Téa: Of course.
Viki: Thank you.
Téa: I understand what it is to need a clean break from someone.
Viki: Of course you do. Todd.
Téa: I would have lost Daniela if I had stayed with him. I had to choose my child.
Viki: Well, of course you did. Of course you did. But you know, she--she may very well learn to accept Todd.
Téa: Well, I can only hope. But I can't count on that.

Viki: You can be open to it, though, right? And if she decides that she can live with the fact that Todd is her father, you two might still have a chance. Children have a remarkable way of bringing people together.
[SCENE_BREAK]
Gigi: Where's Eli?
Rex: I couldn't find him.
Gigi: It's bad news.
Rex: No, we don't know if it's bad news or good news--
Gigi: Oh! The court ruled for us, he'd be here.
Rex: Maybe the call wasn't even about our case.
Gigi: Too late.
Schuyler: Hi. Oh, she looks so much better.
Gigi: Yeah.
Schuyler: Gigi, look, I know you're worried, but I'm going to take such good care of her, and you can come and check up on her anytime you want.
Gigi: I might take you up on that.
Schuyler: Hey. Hey, baby girl. Hey, come on, sweetheart, we're going home, okay? We're going home.
Eli: Hold on. Judge Donnelly just faxed this order to the hospital. Sierra won't be going home with you today, Schuyler.
Schuyler: What did you do?
Gigi: We filed for temporary custody. You knew that.
Eli: They'll be a full custody hearing at a later date.
Schuyler: Yeah, but--but--but the ethics committee cleared me.
Rex: That's not your only problem.
Eli: We raised a lot of issues with you, Mr. Joplin. First of all, you denied the baby for months, then you let her mother, Stacy, be kidnapped by Mitch Laurence.
Schuyler: Yeah, but I'm still--

Eli: Meanwhile, Gigi has proven herself as a parent. She's been a responsible single mother for years, and she's done a great job raising her own son, and she's the baby's aunt. The judge couldn't ignore those facts. You need to give the baby to Gigi.
[SCENE_BREAK]
Rachel: I told Schuyler I think we should get a cabinet here for all the baby stuff.
Greg: And you think a cabinet's going to make it right?
[Rachel sighs]
Rachel: Greg, do you really think that Schuyler can't be a good father, or a good doctor?
Greg: He's proven he can't.
Rachel: I heard there was no proof.
Greg: Oh, cut the bull. Schuyler lied about being the father, and then he stole the oxytocin to put Stacy in early labor to keep the lie going, and you chose Schuyler, anyway.
Rachel: Schuy may have denied being a father then, but he is determined to be a good dad now. He deserves that chance, and I think he'll step up!
Greg: He's an addict!
Rachel: And?
Greg: "And"? That's it. People don't change.
